DOC.HEAD: Chinese Leaders Congratulate New Romanian Government
With PM-Romania, Bjt
Eds: Inserts 1 graf after 4th pvs, `Thousands of...' to UPDATE with portrayal of Romanian uprising in Chinese press. Pickup 5th, `Chinese President...'
DOC.TEXT: Chinese leaders today congratulated the new leaders of Romania and expressed hope for good relations between the countries. China on Tuesday effectively recognized the provisional government that overthrew and executed President Nicolae Ceausescu of Romania. Ceausescu was one of the few world leaders to praise China's military crackdown of a pro-democracy movement in the spring, in which hundreds and possibly thousands of people died. Thousands of people were killed in Romania last week after Ceausescu deployed the military to crush anti-government protesters. Ceausescu and his wife, Elena, were executed Christmas Day. China's official press failed to report Ceausescu's overthrow for more than a day, and it has since depicted the turmoil as a struggle between pro- and anti-Ceausescu forces. It has provided details of Ceausescu's execution and the establishment of a new government but has not mentioned the extent of the popular uprising or the depth of popular hatred for Ceausescu and his family. Chinese President Yang Shangkun, in a message to Ion Iliescu, chairman of Romania's governing National Salvation Committee, said: ``On behalf of the government of the People's Republic of China and in the name of myself, I congratulate you on your election as chairman.'' ``May the friendship between the people of China and Romania and the friendly relations between the two countries continue to develop,'' he added. Premier Li Peng sent a similar message to Romania's new premier, Petre Roman. The Foreign Ministry said it would not interfere in Romania's internal affairs and respects the choice made by the Romanian people.
